replies.bodyText:
Secondary locations are not highlighted for now in SonarLint for VSCode. Only a message is visible in the "Problems" bar. Thus I would change the primary message just a bit to replace "these". What do you think of:
"Remove this and every subsequent useless "eq(...)" invocation; pass the values directly."
That way we make more explicit what other "eq()" calls we refer to.
replies.author: nicolas-harraudeau-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText: I feel this will violate @nicolas-harraudeau-sonarsource 's rule about never having text in secondaries. Can you check?
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText:
@m-g-sonar thanks for pinging me.
If I understand correctly we want to have secondary locations on every subsequent call to eq(). It seems to me that the calls to given, when and verify will rarely be split on many lines. If it is the case developers won't expect to navigate to eq() calls. They will all be visible right away.
As there is no need for navigation to these secondary locations, nor to to explain them (the primary message is clear enough), I would say that we don't need a secondary location message. Secondary locations are only there to improve issues' readability.
Does it make sense?
replies.author: nicolas-harraudeau-sonarsource

replies.bodyText:
Make sense. And to be clear:
new JavaFileScannerContext.Location("", ExpressionUtils.methodName(eq))

is already a message-less secondary, as methodName() returns a tree and is used for the location.
